main event: A B-26 pilot observed a pulsating white light maneuvering at a high speed over Yokota Air Base, Japan on August 6, 1952.
interesting points: The sighting lasted approximately 2 minutes before the object suddenly accelerated and disappeared., The object was reported to be at an estimated altitude of 15,000 feet and 8 to 10 miles away from the observer., The report included a conclusion that the object might be a comet., There were no sounds or physical evidence detected during the observation., The sighting was made during night gunnery operations at 7,000 feet.
witness description: pilots of a B-26 type aircraft
